title: Hiatal Hernia with Reflux Disease
diagnosis_topic: Sliding hiatal hernia associated with GERD symptoms
setup_script: “A 55-year-old overweight woman presents with chronic heartburn, regurgitation, and chest discomfort that worsens when lying down. She has been taking proton pump inhibitors for two years with only partial relief. She also reports occasional nocturnal cough, hoarseness, and dysphagia. Her BMI is 32 kg/m². How would you proceed?”

dynamic_flow.reply: “She reports typical GERD symptoms, nocturnal cough, hoarseness, and occasional dysphagia.”
“Endoscopy shows erosive esophagitis with Los Angeles grade B changes and a 3 cm sliding hiatal hernia.”
“Study confirms a sliding hiatal hernia with reflux of contrast into the esophagus.”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident orders esophageal pH monitoring and manometry
dynamic_flow.reply: “Results show increased acid exposure time, normal peristalsis, and a low LES pressure.”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident recommends lifestyle modifications and optimizes PPI therapy
dynamic_flow.reply: “You counsel on weight loss, head of bed elevation, avoidance of late meals and acidic foods, and increase PPI dosing.”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If symptoms persist despite medical therapy
dynamic_flow.reply: “She remains symptomatic and is now a candidate for surgical repair. What options would you consider?”
“You discuss laparoscopic Nissen fundoplication (360°) versus a partial wrap depending on motility findings.”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If paraesophageal component or hernia >5 cm is identified
dynamic_flow.reply: “Surgical repair is recommended even if asymptomatic to prevent risk of strangulation.”
“Manometry confirms adequate esophageal peristalsis to tolerate a complete wrap.”
“You explain that transient dysphagia is common, and she should avoid carbonated beverages and large meals, advancing diet gradually.”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident delays surgery in symptomatic hiatal hernia
dynamic_flow.reply: “She remains at risk for chronic esophagitis, Barrett’s esophagus, and pulmonary aspiration.”
“She is counseled on the importance of adherence to PPI therapy and lifestyle measures even after surgery for long-term control.”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident describes technical operative steps
dynamic_flow.reply: “Please describe in detail your operative approach for laparoscopic fundoplication.”

critical_decision_points: Evaluation of hiatal hernia and GERD with endoscopy, pH monitoring, and manometry
Initial management with lifestyle modification and optimized medical therapy
Recognition of indications for surgical repair and appropriate fundoplication technique
Technical steps of laparoscopic hiatal hernia repair and fundoplication
Preoperative assessment of esophageal motility to guide surgical planning
Postoperative care, including dietary expectations and dysphagia management
